greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of entries in the k-th cycles of all permutations of [n] when cycles are ordered by decreasing lengths (and increasing smallest elements); triangle T(n,k), n>=1, 1<=k<=n, read by rows.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..141, flattened
Andrew V. Sills, Integer Partitions Probability Distributions, arXiv:1912.05306 [math.CO], 2019.
example: so there are 13 elements in the first cycles, 4 in the second cycles and only 1 in the third cycles.
maple: b:= proc(n, l) option remember; `if`(n=0, add(l[-i]*
mathematica: b[n_, l_] := b[n, l] = If[n == 0, Sum[l[[-i]]*x^i, {i, 1, Length[l]}], Sum[Binomial[n-1, j-1]*b[n-j, Sort[Append[l, j]]]*(j-1)!, {j, 1, n}]];
Array[T, 12] // Flatten  (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 26 2020, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Dec 05 2018
